reviews.review_msg: Coley is a great prof. You can tell that he is passionate about the material he teaches, and that really comes off during his lectures. He makes reading medieval texts fun and interesting, and his laid back vibe makes him very easy to approach. Highly recommend

David is a wonderful professor! He makes complex Chaucer readings interesting and fun - he is absolutely hilarious! David cares so much about his students and is always willing to help. Make sure you do your readings though - otherwise you will be lost. The class goes by so fast b/c everyone is so engaged. One of my favourite classes at SFU so far!
Fantastic prof! Extremely helpful and available for his students. He cares so much for the texts and his students. My favourite professor so far. he really grabs your attention and keeps you engaged!

I have the honour of having Dr. Higgins as my professor from first year until fourth. She made me think, she made me work and she made me excited about English that never had in former years. I think she is a gem, an inspiration and most importantly a decent human being. Thank you SFU for choosing wonderful professors.

First time taking her. Lectures are all over the place with little to no direction. It was a Chaucer course, and students who are not familiar with his work would be very lost. Many of the deadlines changed as well, so it was confusing. However, if you go and see her, she is very helpful. She is also willing to do extensions and talk one on one.

Dr. Higgins is the best professor I've met in SFU! She's caring, nice and patient! She is definitely a Chaucer expert as well as Middle English. You may think her lectures are disorganized, but that's what Chaucer was- lots of issues! and you are the one to straighten them out with the assistance of Dr. Higgins :D

Good prof, very passionate & shows great knowledge in both Chaucer & ME in general. Although interesting, lectures are slightly irrelevant. The exam is based 100% on translations, no insight in any text is necessary since there's no essays. 1 8pg essay during the semester and about 6 short, easy quizzes. highly recommend her as a prof.
Though Anne's lectures were at times unfocused, she infused her lectures with humour and submitted fresh and interesting perspectives on the course texts.  A thoroughly enjoyable prof.

Anne is great despite the lateness-thing. Her so-called tangents do have a point (to those linear thinkers out there). She is a true teacher and my writing has benefitted tremendously under her advice. An 'A' from her means something.
her lecture had absolutely nothing to do with course material.  slow marker

Easily the best teacher I've had in my 4 years at university. He expects a lot from his students, but I personally wouldn't have it any other way. Those looking for an easy A need not apply, but those who can match his passion for all things English won't want the semester to end.
Very nice lady.  Willing to help.  Clear explanations.  Very enuthiastic with her teaching subjects.  Knowledgable.  Makes learning the subject fun and easy.
